name: Gluten-Free Flatbread
author: FreeCellPenguin
summary: I first made these to go with gyros. I folded mine over, and it was pretty close to the taste of a whole-wheat pita!
directions: Combine sorghum flour, quinoa flour, cornstarch, tapioca flour, potato starch flour, baking soda, xanthan gum, salt, and yeast together in a bowl
Stir water, olive oil, cider vinegar, and honey together in a separate bowl until honey is dissolved; pour over flour mixture and mix until dough comes together in a ball
Place 1/4 cup dough between 2 sheets waxed paper or plastic wrap and roll until very thin using a rolling pin or tortilla press
Place on the prepared baking sheet and repeat with remaining dough; let rise for 30 minutes
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Bake in the preheated oven for 8 minutes
